name: Barney Greengrass
address: 541 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA

reviews.text: The food was good. But it's quite pricey.
This was a true Jewish deli experience, everything was so fresh and freshly prepared, wait staff was attentive and quick , and the ambiance felt very homey. Only thing is make sure to bring cash.
just had an exceptional smoked turkey sandwich with tomato and Russian dressing on pumpernickel.
This is NYC.  A bustling Jewish deli.  I had probably the best lox, cream cheese and sesame bagel sandwich ever
Such a staple NYC restaurant.
Terrific lox and sturgeon. Gary is great and a legend.
Expensive but good as a treat
Great sturgeon, latkes and pickles. Kind owners and staff
Odliƒçan restoran 5
Amei a comida! Especialmente o bagel de salm√£o fumado. √ìtima qualidade os ingredientes. √â pena o atendimento n√£o ser muito caloroso

Le saumon fum√© est hyper sal√©. Je ne comprends pas cet engouement des am√©ricains pour du sel. J‚Äôai bu tout l‚Äôapr√®s-midi. Ce n‚Äôest pas bon pour la sant√© autant de sel. C‚Äôest m√™me pas mangeable.
Sinon le sandwich sturgeon bon mais le pain tr√®s moyen.
Le prix annonc√© 27$ sur l‚Äôaddition appara√Æt 30$ sur la note finale et puis ce caf√© tr√®s bas de gamme de tr√®s mauvaise qualit√© √† 4$ par contre d√©sol√©e c‚Äôest du vol.
Le sandwich de pastrami coup√© en 2 moiti√© tr√®s bon et l‚Äôautre moiti√© plein de morceaux de gras et de cartilages.
Pour finir les serveurs et serveuses font la gueule m√™me pas un sourire et √† la fin ils r√©clament un pourboire.
Pardon mais √ßa ne valait pas du tout le prix qu‚Äôon a pay√©.
Quick service, delicious latkes, and amazing homemade pickles. Only downside was pigeon poop on the shoulder while waiting in line.
Love this place. The staff is super kind, the place is so authentic.
Fabulous food! Great NYC humor do not miss this icon.the best fish

Cash only on weekends; cards accepted on weekdays.
Classic Jewish appetizing shop full of history and delicious bagels! The Nova Scotia salmon was top notch and the latkes were crispy and huge. Service is no frills and mildly abrasive. Prices are steep but where aren‚Äôt prices steep in Manhattan?
Authentic and cozy place. Incredible dishes. White fish salad is amazing. Sturgeon is a must try.

This is a review from many years ago - a story involving Anthony Bourdain.

We have a friend who lives in Asia, and worked for a large local TV conglomerate. They purchased sports, and entertainment content, including Parts Unknown.

We had hosted our friend in NY City when she was travelling and,  - Asians can be quite some foodies -- so we did lots of nice restaurants, and Zabar's and Fairway,  and we brought her to Barney Greengrass.

The lox and smoked sturgeon is to die for!  But Sturgeon and Sable are ...IYKYK.   The lox is damn good too.

Back in Asia, Anthony Bourdain was filming, probably the segment in Penang, so when he was heading back, the TV station hosted a reception for him and his producers.

Our friend met him  at the party and they were chatting. She said she had just come back from NY and really enjoyed the food. The bagels and lox were just great. He looked at her incredulously, probably imagining that she went to some tourist trap, had some pretty unexceptional food.  You know he could get pretty snarky.  Anyhow, he said, "yeah, so tell me where did you go?"

She said "Barney Greengrass". He was shocked  -- "Barney Greengrass! ??No way. How did you know?  It's the best!" Just amazing. The smoked fish is the best! It's a NY institution...."

Her street cred just went through the roof.

And we helped. But Barney Greengrass did mostly.
Molt amables I bon√≠ssim!
Old school deli with great smoked fish

Cash only historical fish spot with a pretty extensive menu. Really good bites and no frills setting.

Got the nova with an everything bagel appetizer as my main and it was honestly the best nova I‚Äôve ever had. Bright, flavorful, but not too fishy. Plenty of cream cheese and extras to dress my bites with. TBH it was so good that it may have ruined all other nova for me.

My husband got the scrambled eggs and sturgeon and he loved it too. Perfect amount of saltiness. The everything bagels were also solid.

Definitely get the potato pancakes, they‚Äôre puffy and crispy with plenty of sour cream and applesauce.

It‚Äôs pricier than some other spots but for me, the quality of the fish was markedly better which made it worth it to me.

Loved our breakfast. If you haven't tried Sturgeon before you don't know what you are missing! My new favorite fish, by far! I have two negative things to mention. $12.00 for just 2 scrambled eggs is outrageous and I ordered chopped liver but instead I received chopped Herring. I enjoyed the herring but was looking forward to trying their chopped liver. Will definitely return.
Amazing smoked fish! Loved the sable. Overall very satisfying breakfast/lunch. I did feel that the bagels could‚Äôve been better, but that could be personal preference. Still a good breakfast

Historical place, Anthony Bourdain was said that this is the best breakfast in the universe.
Price is fine, service ok, and the food is well done. At least to pass by time to time
They are not respecting the line.
Best bagels and lox - anywhere! Hands down. Even the cream cheese is next level.
Just about the best deli in town. Every thing is perfect.

No doubt this is an institution been around since early 1908 and they moved from original Harlem to Upper west. You walk in and it‚Äôs just a quintessential hustle bustle NYC fish focused deli. **it‚Äôs cash ONLY

They feature mainly salted fish from sturgeon to salmon etc.. pair that with a bagel and you are set for a solid breakfast. The potato puffers are good even having come from Germany. They are crisp on the outside golden and softy and doughy with the balanced acidity it needs.

As far as value for what it is it‚Äôs terrible and priced up there. 2 bagel combos, 1 potato puffer, 2x OJ you‚Äôre looking at 109$ without tip.
Noa made our experience memorable and provided yummy recommendations. Food was excellent. Black and white cookies were delicious and soft. Get the sturgeonnnnn!
True classic Jewish deli, the latkes and salmon were fantastic but overall $39 for a bagel sandwich with pastrami salmon and 3 latkes was too pricey for me to make it a regular habit
The BEST !!!

What a dud!!! Wanted to try a deli I hadn‚Äôt been to and this place was totally overrated.

Sandwich portions were incredibly small, average slaw and pickles, knish was not even served hot.

Much better options in NYC!!
Incredible lox bagel, great old-school vibes inside, super friendly, the casher was a true mensch. Will be back, can't miss this place if you're in the upper west side.
Love this spot! Excellent food. Gotta have a latke.
Delicious!! Just make sure you bring cash. It‚Äôs also very loud inside when is crowded
Try the sturgeon and Nova Scotia salmon sandwich on everything bagel with cream cheese. This place is the king of sturgeon for a reason!
This place was delicious perfection. The lox bagel was literally the best bagel I‚Äôve ever had in my life. I definitely recommend it. No question.
Yummy :)
The latkes and pastrami eggs were delicious. Classic breakfast spot. The service was polite, but you need to know what you want ASAP. Also, it's CASH ONLY!
Nice outdoor seating is available. Unique dishes. Lot's of fish choices.
Best Latke of my life!!! Totally recommend.

Old school Jewish delicious.
Pricey but solid.
We love this place.
Classic spot for smoked fish and baked goods.

this place is a scream. I‚Äôve been going here for years‚Ä¶. good place to possibly spot someone famous of course we had the traditional lox and bagel with white fish salad not disappointed. They constantly refill your coffee cup. never disappointed. Bring cash on the weekend for some reason no credit cards on the weekend I believe.

Ôºà„ÉÅ„Éß„Ç¶„Ç∂„É°„Å®„Éé„Éê„Çπ„Ç≥„Ç∑„Ç¢„Çµ„Éº„É¢„É≥Ôºâ

„Å®„Åã„Åå„Åä„Åô„Åô„ÇÅ„Åß„ÅôÔºÅ
Delicious lox
Place is a ripoff. $28 for the least stuffed piece of sandwich you ever seen. If I‚Äôm paying that much, at least fill it up.

The food was okay, but the most disappointing part was the confusing and uncomfortable payment process. After our meal, the waiter brought the check without us asking, and only then told us it was cash only. There had been no prior notice‚Äînothing on the menu or posted in the restaurant‚Äîand it was never mentioned when we ordered.

Since we only had cards, one of us had to run out into the rain to find an ATM. When they came back (we hadn‚Äôt taken long), the waiter immediately returned to ask for payment. He had said earlier that there was no tax or tip, so we assumed the amount on the bill was final and paid the exact total in cash.

But then he commented that tip wasn‚Äôt included, which left us confused and a bit embarrassed. It turned out he meant tax wasn‚Äôt required, but tip still was‚Äîyet that wasn‚Äôt clearly communicated. If that had been explained properly, we absolutely would have left a tip. Instead, the whole situation felt unnecessarily awkward and uncomfortable.

There was clearly a misunderstanding, but it could have been avoided with clearer communication. A simple sign or note on the menu saying ‚ÄúCash Only‚Äù would have helped a lot. It‚Äôs a small thing, but it changes the entire experience.

I recently enjoyed being served by an outstanding waitress named Kelsea. Her exceptional disposition and attentive service truly enhanced my dining experience.
Thank you, Kelsey.

An old New York classic breakfast spot with a variety of breakfast cured fishes, prepared either as a breakfast sandwich, platter, or with eggs. I‚Äôd recommend a breakfast sandwich, which is the most economical, and the white fish salad as the fish.

There‚Äôs often a line to get in, but it moves at a decent speed.

An old New York gem‚ÄîBarney Greengrass is the real deal. Charming dining room, incredibly welcoming and engaging staff, and the best smoked fish in the city. Bagels, pastries, and fresh-squeezed OJ are all top-notch. A true institution and a joy every time.

Stopped by with a friend for a Sunday lunch recently - there was a bit of a queue but we were pretty lucky to get seated within ~10 min (the queue got much longer once we were eating).

They were serving potato latkes that day (which, after reading some reviews, isn't available all the time?), so we ordered a plate - they were amazing! Potatoes tasted light and fluffy, outside perfectly crispy without being too hard or oily, and portion size was pretty big (and you know starches can fill you up quickly haha). They came with applesauce and sour cream which paired excellently.

My friend and I each ordered a bagel sandwich - I had the gravlox sandwich. The smoked fish was... fine? Maybe I should have tried the sturgeon (I think their speciality), but I have to say I'm not really sure why there's such a craze around their smoked fishes. It was all very yummy but I fear not uniquely so, and for $21 a bagel I honestly am just a bit perplexed by this.

Bit of a mixed bag here - I'd be keen to come back but honestly it would primarily be for the latkes haha. Also note that they are cash only, so come prepared!

Without a doubt, the best bagel I've tried in the city.
Great quality smoked fish on a freshly baked bagel. The ambiance is an old style deli. It's cramped inside, especially over the weekend, but the staff is great, very fast and somehow it all runs smoothly.
Cash only!!! I didn't read the sign and didn't have any cash. The owner at the cash register was kind enough to keep my order on the side so that I could go withdraw some cash.

A true New York City institution, this establishment has been in business for over a century, offering a taste of history and culinary legacy. The smoked fish here is unparalleled‚Äîthe finest I‚Äôve ever encountered. The perfect balance of smokiness and saltiness, paired with high-quality salmon and sturgeon, creates a flavor profile that is nothing short of exceptional. When combined with their toasted bagels, the experience becomes an embodiment of tradition and craftsmanship. In my opinion, this is the most iconic food destination in New York City.

Divinity!!!
10/10 for the white fish salad! Tasty, plentiful, light on the mayo, heavy on the fish!! Oh and no bones!! Immaculate

The BLC (bagel lox cream) divine as well! So generous with portions, at this point you can‚Äôt go anywhere without a BLC costing around 20 buckaroonies at least here they give you your moneys worth with a hearty portion of lox!

Latkas:
Look I know their latkas is a top seller for them. I‚Äôm bias towers skinny crunchy lats so these are not for me.

Side note:
Do not be intimidated by the line. There was a huge line and it moved so quickly. Highly recommend!!

Secondo il mio giudizio il miglior panino col pastrami di new york  .
√â un ristorante di quartiere , non turistico , con piatti tradizionali della cucina ebraica ed americana. Il servizio √® eccellente,  il cibo sano e gustoso e l ambiente accogliente e caldo. In una zona poco turistica di new york ma da visitare assolutamente

„Éã„É•„Éº„É®„Éº„ÇØÊúÄÂæå„ÅÆÊúùÈ£ü„Å´‰º∫„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ„ÉÜ„Ç§„ÇØ„Ç¢„Ç¶„Éà„ÅßÁÑ°„Åè„Ç§„Éº„Éà„Ç§„É≥„ÅØÂ∑¶Êâã„ÅÆ„Éõ„Éº„É´„ÅßÈ†Ç„ÅèÊßò„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ„ÉÅ„Éß„Ç¶„Ç∂„É°„Å®„Çπ„É¢„Éº„ÇØ„Çµ„Éº„É¢„É≥„ÅåÊúâÂêç„Å®ËÅû„ÅÑ„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åü„ÅÆ„Åß„Çπ„Éö„Ç∑„É£„É™„ÉÜ„ÅÆ„É°„Éã„É•„Éº„Å´„ÅÇ„Çã„Ç≥„É≥„Éì„Éç„Éº„Ç∑„Éß„É≥„Å´„Éô„Éº„Ç∞„É´ËøΩÂä†„ÄÅ„ÅÇ„Å®„Ç≥„Éº„Éí„Éº„ÇíÈ†º„Åø„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇÊñôÁêÜ„ÅØ„Çµ„É≥„Éâ„Ç§„ÉÉ„ÉÅ„ÅÆÂΩ¢„ÅßÈÅã„Å∞„Çå„Çã„ÅÆ„Åã„Å®ÊÄù„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åó„Åü„Åå„Çª„Éë„É¨„Éº„Éà„Åß„Åó„Åü(È†º„ÇÅ„Å∞Êåü„Çì„Åß„Åè„Çå„ÇãÊßò„Åß„Åô)„ÄÇ
Âë≥„ÅØ„Åæ„ÅÇÊôÆÈÄö„Åß„Åô„Å≠„ÄÇÁÅ´„ÇíÈÄö„Åó„Å¶„Åó„Åæ„ÅÜ„Å®„ÉÅ„Éß„Ç¶„Ç∂„É°„ÇÇ„Çµ„Éº„É¢„É≥„ÇÇ„Åü„Å†„ÅÆÁôΩË∫´È≠ö„Å®„ÅÑ„ÅÜÊÑü„Åò„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ„Åü„Å†„ÅäÂ∫ó„ÅÆÈõ∞Âõ≤Ê∞óÂú∞ÂÖÉÊ∞ë„ÅÆÂ∫ó„Å®„ÅÑ„ÅÜÊÑü„Åò„Å™„ÅÆ„ÅßÂáÑ„ÅèÁ¥†Êïµ„Åß„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ„ÉÅ„ÉÉ„ÉóËæº„Åø„Åß40„Éâ„É´„Åß„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ
ÁèæÈáëÊâï„ÅÑ„ÅÆ„Åø„Å®„ÅÆË©±„Åß„Åó„Åü„ÅåÂâç„ÅÆ„ÅäÂÆ¢„Åï„Çì„ÅØ„Ç´„Éº„Éâ„ÅßÊîØÊâï„ÅÑ„Çí„Åó„Åü„Åø„Åü„ÅÑ„Åß„Åô(Ëá™ÂàÜ„ÅØÁèæÈáë„ÅßÊîØÊâï„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åó„Åü)„ÄÇ

This is the old school Jewish Deli we all need. December is the time of the year to get their latkes. Smoked Salmon on a Bagel with Capers and Challah French Toast were just what we were looking for.

The pickle plate hit the spot - surprisingly the pickled tomatoes were my favorite.

Renowned NYC deli institution known for the smoked fish. We bought home everything bagels along with Smoked lox, Pastrami salmon, olives, pickles, and scallion cream cheese. The salmon were an absolute delight! The bagels had a shiny crust and a perfectly soft and chewy interior. The black and white NYC cookies were on point: the cookie itself was slightly cakey and moist, and the tangy vanilla side contrasted really well with the slightly sweet chocolate side (but could‚Äôve been  bit creamier/fudgier). The staff were not the most welcoming, and cash is required. Seating space is available but is limited.

- Llegu√© a este lugar un fin de semana de Agosto alrededor de las 3:30 p.m. La ocupaci√≥n del lugar era de 5 mesas.

- Orden√© moelinas olives, pastrami salmon y pastrami salami.

- En cuanto al sabor de los alimentos te dir√© que era bueno. Nada espectacular como para regresar, sin embargo, estuvo bien.

- Es un lugar familiar.

- Apto para ni√±os.

- Cuentan con mesas en interior, exterior sobre la banqueta techadas con lona y a un costado de la banqueta.

- No encontr√© red wifi disponible.

- No aceptan tarjetas de cr√©dito ni d√©bito como m√©todo de pago adicional al efectivo.

- Si tienes movilidad reducida y/o vas en silla de ruedas, te comento que el acceso y movilidad dentro del lugar es de dificultad alta. El espacio entre las mesas es reducido.

- Al lugar le falta mucho orden y limpieza.

- En cuanto entras al lugar, en donde est√°n los refrigeradores, hay muchas cosas muy juntas y mal acomodadas, es abrumador estar ah√≠, te sugiero te sientes en las mesas del fondo o en la parte de afuera.

- La atenci√≥n fue buena.

- El servicio fue r√°pido.

- No cuentan con estacionamiento propio.

- Hay varias √°reas de oportunidad en las que pueden mejorar.
Truly the sturgeon KING! Great bagels and yummy latkes. We had the honor of sitting at the ledge! Can‚Äôt go wrong.

A culinary Institution for over 100 years, located in the Upper West Side, offers one of the better Nova and other amazing Smoked Fishes in town. Other Deli specialties include Potato Latkes, Pastrami, Corned Beef, Blintzes and other delicacies. Beware that only Cash payments are accepted. Service is extremely helpful. Highly recommended experience!

One of those institutional places in nyc you have to try and won‚Äôt be disappointed! The food was so delicious and the staff were amazing. The restaurant is cozy with lots of table but it fills up super quickly depending on the time and day you go. On a weekend, you can definitely expect to wait during brunch hours. We went around 1:30pm and it was easier to get a table then. Make sure to have enough cash because it is cash only!

July 2023: (Cash or check only!)
Stopped by for lunch. First time here in over 15+ years. I remember the sable was really good.

Note that I was surprised that they only accept cash or a check. I didn't see any signs warning us. Luckily, I was planning on going to Peter Luger's this week, so I had some üíµ.

We got seated inside near the bathroom and it was a bit cramped. But no problem since they were really busy.

We ordered the latkas and the combination sturgeon and salmon plate. The potato pancakes came out very fast. They were served with üçé sauce and sour cream. Overall, was okay. The pancakes didn't have much flavor on their own. You really needed the sour cream and apple sauce to make it interesting.

The sturgeon and salmon plate was tasty. We ordered sesame bagel ü•Ø with the plate. Cream cheese, tomato üçÖ, onion üßÖ, a pickle ü•í, olives ü´í and some lettuce came with the plate. Together, the sturgeon and salmon were pretty good. I'd come back again if I was in the neighborhood and craving a salmon lox sandwich.

OMG - why is there not a queue a mile looooong to get onto this place. Once TikTok dIscovers it, it will become the next viral place. Established for over a century, the food is outstanding and the team is amazing. NYC at its best. Go - like NOW !!!

„Çµ„Éº„É¢„É≥„ÇÇ„ÇØ„É™„Éº„É†„ÉÅ„Éº„Ç∫„ÇÇÊÉú„Åó„Åø„Å™„Åè‰Ωø„Çè„Çå„Å¶„ÅÑ„Å¶„ÄÅ„Éú„É™„É•„Éº„É†Ê∫ÄÁÇπ„ÅßÈ£ü„ÅπÂøú„Åà„ÅÇ„Çä„ÄÇ
„Éã„É•„Éº„É®„Éº„ÇØ„Å∏Ë°å„Å£„ÅüÈöõ„ÅØ„Åú„Å≤Ë∂≥„ÇíÈÅã„Çì„Åß„Åè„Å†„Åï„ÅÑÔºÅ

This is a store that serves delicious salmon bagels anyway.
Both salmon and cream cheese are used sparingly, and they are hearty and satisfying.
If you are ever in New York, be sure to visit!

Amazing turkey and pastrami sandwich. It may be the best I‚Äôve had since in years. I prefer this place to tourist traps like Katz Deli. The meats were juicy and well-spiced and the bagel on top was incredible. The cole slaw was sweet and crispy and worked well with the russian dressing. We started with potato latkes that were great with the apple sauce.

The servers were friendly and had great jokes.

The ambiance is an old style deli. Went during the week and didn‚Äôt have any line.

Will come again when we are in NyC.

I would skip the matzah ball soup and OD on the meats and sandwiches or latkes instead.
Bialy and bagels/cream cheese were great.  Sturgeon and kippers were FABULOUS.   Matzo ball soup was only ok.  It wasn't worth 9.50.  Pickle platter was good.  Seating is very tight and stuffy.

Prices are a little high but you get what you pay for. CASH ONLY. Review the menu before you arrive because they want you to order quick. Generous selection of fish. Best bagel and nova salmon I've ever had. Perfectly paired with a Dr. Brown's Cream Soda. Start with a side of potato latkes ("potato pancakes").

Best toasted whole grain flagel with nova, tomato, onion, capers and veggie cream cheese
ease ever

Outstanding!!! Anthony Bourdain was right the sturgeon is awesome. Customer service was fantastic!! Food was outstandingly awesome!!!! The best in the city.  Everyone needs to come here at least once in their lifetime and experience a true delicatessen!!! And buy a loaf of rye bread, it is perfect.

Really enjoy eating here. Food comes quickly and they're delicious. We had a challah French toast, whitefish salad and a hot pastrami sandwich. The French toast was eggy and delicious. The whitefish salad was not my favorite. There are better places to get them if you're willing to travel a bit. The star was the hot pastrami sandwich. Soft, salty, spicy, just perfect. The service here is also great. Friendly wait staff and near constant refills of coffee! I kept hearing them recommend latkes. They're not on the menu but I hope to try it soon!

I visited this place because it was a favorite of the great Anthony Bourdaine -- and for good reason! They do an excellent Jewish breakfast, and I actually tried eggs with a variety of fish for the first time ever. The service was super friendly and attentive, and the place was so busy it was overflowing onto the sidewalk. Definitely make some time to stop here if you're on the upper west side and check out all of the cool pictures of Barney with various celebrities.

One of the revered establishments of UWS for good reason: their latkes are so crispy with an applesauce and sour cream that complement them. Smoked fish on a freshly baked bagel: absolutely stellar. A bit cramped inside but honestly impressive watching the staff at work‚Äîflowing seamlessly from table to table!

Bare bones service. No space is wasted and an attitude that everything is storage. Clean. Perfection. Cash or card

It's fast, no frills.

Sturgeon scramble was delicious and served piping hot. Nicely toasted bagel that itself was great. Served with cream cheese.

The price for breakfast will probably set you back 30 dollars including tax and tip. Cheaper options are available if you want to grab and go

Given the legendary status, this place probably doesn't need a new review. The atmosphere, the vibe and especially the food won't disappoint you. We got latkes, herring sandwich and pastrami sandwich. There was a line before we got seated, the line goes faster if you are ok with seating outside.

I only had three bagels in New York, but this was easily the best one. The pastrami smoked salmon was also delicious, but it's the pickle that came with my sandwich that I'm still thinking about two weeks later. Will I ever have a pickle as good? Should I have emptied my suitcase of belongings and filled it with pickles, instead? I'll be back someday. Wait for me, pickles.

Famous people like Anthony Bourdaine, among others, have frequented this UWS staple for years. However, Barney Greengrass is not bombarded with tourists like Russ & Daughters or Katz's Delicatessen in the LES. You'll find local regulars sitting outside munching down on potato latkes, scrambled eggs & toasted bagels. Their specialty is smoked fish. Nova lox & cream cheese on an everything bagel is delicious but BG is the sturgeon king for a reason. The sturgeon is delicious! Service is friendly, fast & attentive, but on this visit, the server forgot the tomato slices & potato salad with my Sturgeon & Nova Lox Platter order üòæ. Prices aren't cheap but reasonable for the generous portions. I like how BG is famous but still has a down to Earth, local New Yorker vibe. These kinds of old school New York establishments are a dying breed. So glad they survived the Covid lockdowns. Highly recommended. Support your local restaurants & small businesses üëç

Un √©tablissement historique au charme d'antan. Produits de qualit√©, service plut√¥t rapide et agr√©able. Mais le prix des plats est exorbitant car cela ne reste que des sandwichs ou des bagels. Il faut compter par personne de 35-40$ juste pour une assiette et une boisson. Ce lieu reste n√©anmoins une adresse √† visiter.
